p:
The gaps are likely to have been identified through the WHO‐led Joint External Evaluations process but have remained unrectified due to financial challenges. This causes an ethical quagmire, as the inequitable distribution of resources, and poor country capacity to build technical expertise for planning and preparing for outbreak, epidemic and pandemic responses may be exaggerated by the inefficient use of the limited financial resources by the countries.
